Warm-up (2-3 min)

Forethought review:

ge mi gi do = ? (meaning)
ga mi gi do = ? (meaning)

(Answers: both I and you, either I or you)

New Material (5-7 min)

Negating Connectives

You can negate either or both parts of a connective:

Cmavo Meaning Logic
na.e A but not B A true, B false
.enai B but not A A false, B true
na.enai neither A nor B both false

Using na.e (A but not B)

mi na.e do cu klama

I but not you go. (I go, you don't.)

la .alis. na.e la .bob. cu gleki

Alice but not Bob is happy.

Using .enai (B but not A)

mi .enai do cu klama

Not I but you go. (You go, I don't.)

Using na.enai (Neither...Nor)

mi na.enai do cu klama

Neither I nor you go.

la .alis. na.enai la .bob. cu tavla

Neither Alice nor Bob talks.

Pattern Summary

Position na nai Result
Before na.e — A not B
After — .enai B not A
Both na.e nai neither

Key Point

Add na before or nai after a connective to negate specific parts.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Use na.e

Translate:

  1. I but not you go.
  2. Alice but not Bob is happy.
  3. The dog but not the cat is big.
Answers
  1. mi na.e do cu klama
  2. la .alis. na.e la .bob. cu gleki
  3. lo gerku na.e lo mlatu cu barda

Exercise 2: Use na.enai

Translate:

  1. Neither I nor you go.
  2. Neither Alice nor Bob talks.
  3. Neither is good.
Answers
  1. mi na.enai do cu klama
  2. la .alis. na.enai la .bob. cu tavla
  3. ti na.enai ta cu xamgu

Exercise 3: Mixed

Choose the right connective:

  1. Both go (and) → .___
  2. At least one goes (or) → .___
  3. I go, you don't → na.___
  4. Neither goes → na.___nai
Answers
  1. .e
  2. .a
  3. na.e
  4. na.enai

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I but not you understand." → mi na.e do cu jimpe
  2. "Neither Alice nor Bob is here." → la .alis. na.enai la .bob. cu zvati
  3. "Both are similar." → ti .e ta cu simsa

Today's Grammar

Negated connectives:

Cmavo Meaning
na.e A but not B
.enai B but not A
na.enai neither A nor B

Summary

You learned to negate connectives: na.e (A not B), .enai (B not A), na.enai (neither).
